description:
Website settings: Show the current permission settings.

Fill the Permissions tab with the permissions for the current site.
The permissions are currently read-only -- changing the popup menus
has no effect.

BUG=135407
TEST=Manual

Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=146321

messages.text: Hi Robert, please take a look.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/app/generated_resources.grd
File chrome/app/generated_resources.grd (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/app/generated_resources.grd#newcode293
chrome/app/generated_resources.grd:293: +      <message name="IDS_WEBSITE_SETTINGS_PERMISSION_LABEL" desc="The label for a permission value that is used in the permissions dropdown.">
Thanks for fixing :-)

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.h
File chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.h (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.h#newcode64
chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.h:64: 
Why are you adding these static methods here?

I think you could just rename 
static int PermissionValueToUIStringID(ContentSetting value);
static int PermissionActionUIStringID(ContentSetting value);

which you try to replace.

I find it a bit wired if you split the helper methods for the UI string between "PermissionInfo" and "WebsiteSettingsUI"

I'd prefer to have them all in "WebsiteSettingsUI" for now.

Also I think you are duplicating code here.

Some notes from the screenshot:

- The window's height should be adjusted to the height of the content view of the active tab, so that there's not extra space at the bottom of the tab's content view. (OK in a follow up CL).
- In the [Label]: [Control] layout, the [Label]s should not be horizontally left-aligned, but should be right-aligned on the ':'.

Also, this class should really have some initial tests soon. I'd recommend working on those next.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm
File chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm#newcode68
chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm:68: @interface PermissionPopUpButton : NSPopUpButton
Needs a class-level comment to explain why you're subclassing. Cocoa generally never requires subclassing controls, so explanation is warranted.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm#newcode74
chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm:74: [super initWithFrame:frame pullsDown:NO];
if ((self = [super initWithFrame:frame pullsDown:NO])) {
  // Body of your initializer.
}
return self;

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm#newcode442
chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm:442: ASCIIToUTF16(":");
Localization concerns of doing this?

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm#newcode455
chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm:455: // Create the popup button. Width & height are arbitrary -- it will be sized
& -> and

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm#newcode457
chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm:457: NSRect buttonFrame = NSMakeRect(NSMaxX([label frame]), point.y, 1, 1);
The convention on OS X is to horizontally align on the right edge of the label, s.t. the raggedy edges are left/right instead of center/right. See System Preferences -> {General, CDs & DVDs, Network} for example.

I'll add some tests to this CL tomorrow.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm
File chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm#newcode68
chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm:68: @interface PermissionPopUpButton : NSPopUpButton
On 2012/07/09 18:58:02, rsesek wrote:
> Needs a class-level comment to explain why you're subclassing. Cocoa generally
> never requires subclassing controls, so explanation is warranted.

Yeah, you're right -- there's nothing here (yet) that requires subclassing. I was anticipating needing to subclass in order to do some custom drawing, but now that I think about it, I will likely only need to subclass NSPopUpButtonCell.

I'll pull this into a function for now.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm#newcode457
chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm:457: NSRect buttonFrame = NSMakeRect(NSMaxX([label frame]), point.y, 1, 1);
On 2012/07/09 18:58:02, rsesek wrote:
> The convention on OS X is to horizontally align on the right edge of the label,
> s.t. the raggedy edges are left/right instead of center/right. See System
> Preferences -> {General, CDs & DVDs, Network} for example.

Sent an email to Glen to confirm what he intended. From his mocks, it appears that he wanted them left-aligned, but I can see your point. Since this is still a work in progress, is it ok to land it as is, and then I can fix it in another CL if necessary?

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm
File chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm#newcode457
chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/website_settings_bubble_controller.mm:457: NSRect buttonFrame = NSMakeRect(NSMaxX([label frame]), point.y, 1, 1);
On 2012/07/09 21:19:20, dubroy wrote:
> On 2012/07/09 18:58:02, rsesek wrote:
> > The convention on OS X is to horizontally align on the right edge of the
> label,
> > s.t. the raggedy edges are left/right instead of center/right. See System
> > Preferences -> {General, CDs & DVDs, Network} for example.
> 
> Sent an email to Glen to confirm what he intended. From his mocks, it appears
> that he wanted them left-aligned, but I can see your point. Since this is still
> a work in progress, is it ok to land it as is, and then I can fix it in another
> CL if necessary?

Sure.

Please take another look.

Markus, the changes to WebsiteSettingsUI will require changes in the GTK and views UI implementations. If the changes look ok to you, I will update the other implementations and include them in this CL.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/9001/chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.cc
File chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/9001/chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.cc#newcode37
chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.cc:37: string16 PermissionActionValueToDescription(ContentSetting value) {
You only call this method inside the 'PermissionActionToUIString' method. I think you could get rid of this method by moving the code of the method body to 'PermissionActionToUIString'

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/9001/chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.cc#newcode127
chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.cc:127: string16 WebsiteSettingsUI::PermissionValueToMenuLabel(
I think we don't need this method anymore. Let's just inline the "return ..."
part and move the method 'PermissionValueToUIString' from the anonymous namespace over here. same below.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/9001/chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.cc#newcode142
chrome/browser/ui/website_settings/website_settings_ui.cc:142: string16 WebsiteSettingsUI::PermissionDefaultValueToMenuLabel(
Same as above.

I just need to change the GTK and Windows UI to bring it into line with the new APIs now.

Markus, can you take a look at the GTK and Windows changes?

LGTM GTK changes Adding Elliot for owners approval.
@Elliot: Could you take a look at the trivial GTK changes. Thanks.

LGTM Website settings stuff.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/14003/chrome/browser/ui/views/website_settings/permission_selector_view.cc
File chrome/browser/ui/views/website_settings/permission_selector_view.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10758003/diff/14003/chrome/browser/ui/views/website_settings/permission_selector_view.cc#newcode125
chrome/browser/ui/views/website_settings/permission_selector_view.cc:125: l10n_util::GetStringFUTF16(IDS_WEBSITE_SETTINGS_DEFAULT_PERMISSION_LABEL,
nit: fix indentation

Actually I think you must use one of the following schemes:

 method_name(parm1,
             parm2,
             parm3,
             parm4);
               
or 

 method_name(parm1, parm2
             parm3, parm4

or 

  method_name(
      parm1,
      parm2,
      parm3,
      parm4


AddCheckItem(
    COMMAND_SET_TO_DEFAULT,             
    l10n_util::GetStringFUTF16(
        IDS_WEBSITE_SETTINGS_DEFAULT_PERMISSION_LABEL,
        WebsiteSettingsUI::PermissionValueToUIString(default_setting_)));

or

AddCheckItem(
    COMMAND_SET_TO_DEFAULT,             
    l10n_util::GetStringFUTF16(
        IDS_WEBSITE_SETTINGS_DEFAULT_PERMISSION_LABEL,
        WebsiteSettingsUI::PermissionValueToUIString(default_setting_)));

or 
AddCheckItem(COMMAND_SET_TO_DEFAULT,
             l10n_util::GetStringFUTF16(
                 IDS_WEBSITE_SETTINGS_DEFAULT_PERMISSION_LABEL,
                 WebsiteSettingsUI::PermissionValueToUIString(default_setting_)));

Good point. FYI the convention we generally use is "[Mac] Website settings: ..."

subject: Website settings (Mac): Show the current permission settings.
